. Programs handle compilation and linking of shaders, and store uniform values. They provide
call which allows the application to run the shaders on specified input data.
Set or update uniforms, in this case world and projection matrices
to store buffer values for the vertices of a triangle and drawing
Creating a program for transform feedback, specifying which varyings to use
Creates a new program using the supplied vertex and fragment shaders. The shaders are compiled into WebGLShaders and is created and the shaders are linked.
, optional) - string id (to help indentify the program during debugging).
) - A vertex shader object, or source as a string.
) - A fragment shader object, or source as a string.
) - a list of names of varyings.
) - Optional, specifies how transform feedback should store the varyings.
Deletes resources held by program. Note: Does not currently delete shaders (to enable shader caching).
Relinks a program. Takes the same options as the constructor
Sets named uniforms from a map, ignoring names

) - The name of the uniform to be set. The name of the uniform will be matched with the name of the uniform declared in the shader. You can set more uniforms on the Program than its shaders use, the extra uniforms will simply be ignored.
) - The value to be set. Can be a float, an array of floats, a typed array, a boolean,
etc. The values must match the declarations in the shader.
is the entry point for running shaders, rendering and (optionally calculating data using transform feedback techniques).
object that will be bound and unbound before and after the draw call.
- a map of uniforms that will be set just before the draw call (and remain set after the call).
s that will be bound before the draw call.
- temporary gl settings to be applied to this draw call.
object containing buffers that will receive the output of the transform feedback operation.
- geometry primitive format of vertex data
- must match the type of the "elements" buffer
Parameters for drawing a limited range (WebGL 2 only)
if draw call is blocked due to missing resources.
Runs the shaders in the program, on the attributes and uniforms.

Once a uniform is set, it's size should not be changed. This is only a concern for array uniforms.
The following WebGL APIs are called in this function:
If true, program has been flagged for deletion (by calling

Indicates whether last link operation was successful. Program linking is performed by luma on program initialization
